title: Fatou–Bieberbach domain
summary: In mathematics, a Fatou–Bieberbach domain is a proper subdomain of C n {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{n}} , biholomorphically equivalent to C n {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{n}} . That is, an open set Ω ⊊ C n {\displaystyle \Omega \subsetneq \mathbb {C} ^{n}} is called a Fatou–Bieberbach domain if there exists a bijective holomorphic function f : Ω → C n {\displaystyle f:\Omega \rightarrow \mathbb {C} ^{n}} whose inverse function f − 1 : C n → Ω {\displaystyle f^{-1}:\mathbb {C} ^{n}\rightarrow \Omega } is holomorphic. It is well-known that the inverse f − 1 {\displaystyle f^{-1}} can not be polynomial.
